articles.author: Andrea Shalal, Steve Holland, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Kamala Harris vowed a tougher approach to migration along the U.S. southern border and said she would not withhold weapons to Israel, in her first interview with a major news organization since becoming the Democratic nominee for president.
articles.title: Harris vows tougher approach on migration, supports weapons for Israel

articles.author: Tim Kelly
articles.description: Typhoon Shanshan brought torrential rain across large parts of Japan on Friday, with warnings for flooding and landslides hundreds of miles from the storm's centre, as many transport services ground to a halt and factories closed.
articles.title: Typhoon Shanshan pounds Japan with torrential rains, severe wind

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin has never made any deals with Telegram boss Pavel Durov, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said on Friday, adding that he was not aware of any meetings between the tech entrepreneur and Russian President Vladimir Putin.
articles.title: Kremlin says it made no deals with Telegram's Durov

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The commander of Ukraine's air force said on Friday that it had shared with U.S. partners a preliminary report about an F-16 jet crash that took place on Monday.
articles.title: Ukraine says US partners helping in investigation of F-16 crash

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The far-right Alternative for Germany is predicted to come first in at least one of two elections in eastern states on Sunday, piling pressure on Chancellor Olaf Scholz's federal coalition over the economy, immigration and support for Ukraine.
articles.title: Far-right AfD on track for its first win in eastern German state vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian attack overnight damaged a factory in Ukraine's northern city of Sumy, killed two women and injured at least 11 people, Ukrainian authorities said on Friday.
articles.title: Russian attack kills two, injures 11 in Ukraine's Sumy, authorities say

articles.author: Panarat Thepgumpanat, Chayut Setboonsarng
articles.description: Thailand's anti-corruption commission on Friday said it had launched an investigation into 44 members of the disbanded Move Forward party, 25 of who are current parliamentarians, for supporting legislation seeking to amend the royal insult law.
articles.title: Thai anti-graft body begins new investigation into opposition politicians

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Palestinians in Gaza were waiting on Thursday to see if there would be a pause in fighting to allow a polio vaccination campaign to begin, as the conflict raged across the besieged enclave, killing at least 20 people.
articles.title: Fighting rages in Gaza as Palestinians hope for a pause for polio vaccinations

articles.author: Kate Abnett
articles.description: With less than three months until this year's COP29 UN climate negotiations, countries remain far from agreement on the summit's biggest task: to agree a new funding target to help developing countries cope with climate change.
articles.title: Countries still far apart on COP29 finance goal

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: The Pacific Islands Forum has endorsed a plan to boost police numbers among its members, cutting the need to rely on external forces in a crisis, with China security ally Solomon Islands supporting the Australian-funded initiative on Friday.
articles.title: Pacific Islands to boost regional policing after leaders meeting
